news_header: The Ivorian government has shut down all student unions following the murder of two students linked to the Student and School Federation (Fesci), which has been accused of running illicit activities on campus.
news_text: In response to the killings of two students, Khalifa Diomandé and Zigui Mars Aubin Déagoué, the Ivorian government has announced the closure of all student unions. The Student and School Federation (Fesci) is implicated in the murders, with several members arrested. Investigations uncovered a torture tunnel and a brothel at Félix-Houphouët-Boigny University. Students reported widespread extortion and fear of Fesci, which has a history of organized crime and political involvement. The government's actions included raids that seized weapons and expelled illegal residents from campuses, leading to celebrations among some students and faculty.
